issue.title: WriteProxiesToFile bug
issue.body:
**Version 7 introduced a bug with `ContainerBuilder::writeProxiesToFile()`.**

Previous versions of ProxyFactory had a `bool $writeProxiesToFile` property.
Since 7.0, these checks were updated from `if ($this->writeProxiesToFile) ...` to `if ($this->proxyDirectory) ...`.
No issues here.

Prior to 7.0, ProxyFactory was created in ContainerBuilder by `new ProxyFactory($this->writeProxiesToFile, $this->proxyDirectory)`.
Since 7.0, ProxyFactory is created in ContainerBuilder by `new ProxyFactory($this->proxyDirectory)`.
No issues here.

Until you get to `ContainerBuilder::writeProxiesToFile(bool $writeToFile, string $proxyDirectory = null)`:
The `writeProxiesToFile` parameter essentially has no effect if `proxyDirectory` has anything other than null.

In other words, `writeProxiesToFile(false, 'tmp/proxies')` has exactly the same effect as `writeProxiesToFile(true, 'tmp/proxies')` or even
```php
$builder->writeProxiesToFile(true, 'tmp/proxies');
/* other code */
$builder->writeProxiesToFile(false);
```
or
```php
$builder->writeProxiesToFile($resultOfSomeLogic, $someProxyDirectory);
```


Therefore, to fix this bug, I believe [this line](https://github.com/PHP-DI/PHP-DI/blob/9ea40a5a6970bf1ca5cbe148bc16cbad6ca3db6c/src/ContainerBuilder.php#L250) should be updated to `$this->proxyDirectory = $writeToFile ? $proxyDirectory : null;`

Thoughts?

issue.title: Update best practices doc to mention Constructor Property Promotion
issue.body:
I think now that v7 requires PHP 8.0+, the https://github.com/PHP-DI/PHP-DI/blob/master/doc/best-practices.md doc should be updated to cover recommending Constructor Property Promotion.

For example, it mentions "This is painful when you have more than 5 dependencies, and your constructor is [15 lines of boilerplate code](http://www.whitewashing.de/2013/06/27/extending_symfony2__controller_utilities.html)". This is no longer true using CPP because it keeps it only 5 lines long.

Also, the services example can be simplified by using CPP for its constructor.

Also, the services example can be simplified by using CPP for its constructor.

issue.title: methodParameter() not working as expected
issue.body:
I am not able to use the `methodParameter()` helper as it is stated in the documentation.
Quoting the documentation:
> You can also define only specific parameters: it allows to define the parameters that couldn't be guessed by the autowiring using type-hints.

When I try to use it, PHP-DI becomes unable to resolve the rest of the method arguments although they are properly typed and it is able to resolve them correctly without the extra parameter.
Given the following method definition, autowiring works as expected:
`public function summary(Request $request, Response $response): Response`
Adding an extra parameter and using `methodParameter()` to teach PHP-DI what value to inject, it doesn't work anymore:
`public function summary(Request $request, Response $response, array $versions): Response`
In my definitions:
```php
[
    'versions': ['1.0.1', '1.2.0', '2.0.0'],
    SummaryController::class => DI\autowire()->methodParameter('summary', 'versions', DI\get('versions'))
]
```
The following error exception is raised:
```
Entry "App\Controllers\SummaryController" cannot be resolved: Parameter $request of summary() has no value defined or guessable Full definition: Object ( class = App\Controllers\SummaryController lazy = false __construct( $container = get(DI\Container) ) summary( $request = #UNDEFINED# $response = #UNDEFINED# $versions = get(versions) ) )
```
My PHP-DI version is 6.4.0

comment.body:
Ok, thank you @serge-kvashnin!

While I agree that docs could be a little clearer about what `methodParameter()` actually does, I believe this issue can be closed now.

> You can also define only specific parameters: it allows to define the parameters that couldn't be guessed by the autowiring using type-hints.

issue.title: methodParameter() not working as expected
issue.body:
I am not able to use the `methodParameter()` helper as it is stated in the documentation.
Quoting the documentation:
> You can also define only specific parameters: it allows to define the parameters that couldn't be guessed by the autowiring using type-hints.

When I try to use it, PHP-DI becomes unable to resolve the rest of the method arguments although they are properly typed and it is able to resolve them correctly without the extra parameter.
Given the following method definition, autowiring works as expected:
`public function summary(Request $request, Response $response): Response`
Adding an extra parameter and using `methodParameter()` to teach PHP-DI what value to inject, it doesn't work anymore:
`public function summary(Request $request, Response $response, array $versions): Response`
In my definitions:
```php
[
    'versions': ['1.0.1', '1.2.0', '2.0.0'],
    SummaryController::class => DI\autowire()->methodParameter('summary', 'versions', DI\get('versions'))
]
```
The following error exception is raised:
```
Entry "App\Controllers\SummaryController" cannot be resolved: Parameter $request of summary() has no value defined or guessable Full definition: Object ( class = App\Controllers\SummaryController lazy = false __construct( $container = get(DI\Container) ) summary( $request = #UNDEFINED# $response = #UNDEFINED# $versions = get(versions) ) )
```
My PHP-DI version is 6.4.0

comment.body:
Hi @serge-kvashnin 

> Based on the description, I believe @tlaugier is trying to use PHP-DI's container to inject versions when calling
a SummaryController method, probably like this:
>
> ```php
> $container->call([SummaryController::class, 'summary']);
> ```

Indeed, this is something similar, `summary` in this case is a controller method called by Slim.

I did not understand your explanation however : 
> Its purpose is to inject dependencies into an instance using setters, not during method invocation
Does this mean that `methodParameter` would be used to set a `versions` instance property value before calling the method `summary` ?

If this function is working as expected, do I have another solution to do what I need? Which is injecting a single argument and have all the others be autowired?

issue.title: methodParameter() not working as expected
issue.body:
I am not able to use the `methodParameter()` helper as it is stated in the documentation.
Quoting the documentation:
> You can also define only specific parameters: it allows to define the parameters that couldn't be guessed by the autowiring using type-hints.

When I try to use it, PHP-DI becomes unable to resolve the rest of the method arguments although they are properly typed and it is able to resolve them correctly without the extra parameter.
Given the following method definition, autowiring works as expected:
`public function summary(Request $request, Response $response): Response`
Adding an extra parameter and using `methodParameter()` to teach PHP-DI what value to inject, it doesn't work anymore:
`public function summary(Request $request, Response $response, array $versions): Response`
In my definitions:
```php
[
    'versions': ['1.0.1', '1.2.0', '2.0.0'],
    SummaryController::class => DI\autowire()->methodParameter('summary', 'versions', DI\get('versions'))
]
```
The following error exception is raised:
```
Entry "App\Controllers\SummaryController" cannot be resolved: Parameter $request of summary() has no value defined or guessable Full definition: Object ( class = App\Controllers\SummaryController lazy = false __construct( $container = get(DI\Container) ) summary( $request = #UNDEFINED# $response = #UNDEFINED# $versions = get(versions) ) )
```
My PHP-DI version is 6.4.0

comment.body:
I might be wrong since some bits of information are missing, but it seems like there's a misunderstanding of the
documentation here.

Based on the description, I believe @tlaugier is trying to use PHP-DI's container to inject `versions` when calling
a `SummaryController` method, probably like this:

```php
$container->call([SummaryController::class, 'summary']);
```

However, using `methodParameter()` (which is similar to `method`) will actually attempt this call *after* creating an
instance of the callable (`SummaryController`). Its purpose is to inject dependencies into an instance using setters,
not during method invocation.

For illustration, the code below won't work according to the docs, but it shows what I think @tlaugier is actually
trying to do:

```php
    #[Inject]
    public function summary(#[Inject('versions')] array $versions): ResponseInterface
    {
        return new Response(body: implode(', ', $versions));
    }
```

I assume this issue can therefore be closed.

issue.title: Add declare_strict() in compiled container
issue.body: Add declare(strict_types=1) in the file generated when compiling the container.

comment.body:
I wonder if this can have side-effects 🤔

We're embedding user code in there, what if they are not using the strict mode? 🤔

pull_request.title: Add declare_strict() in compiled container
pull_request.body: Add declare(strict_types=1) in the file generated when compiling the container.
